translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter with Kuṇḍadhāna
The Elder Mogharāja’s Birth Story
“The Blessed One, the Seer of the Truth,
self-arisen, unconquered,
surrounded by the Saṅgha of monks,
set out on the road.
Surrounded by my disciples,
I went forth from the house.
Having gone forth there,
I saw the Leader of the World.
Having paid homage to the Buddha,
placing my head at his feet,
having gladdened my own mind,
I delighted the Leader of the World.
As far as there are beings with form,
or formless, or without perception;
all of them within your knowledge

translated: are included and gathered together.🔽One who would try to filter out the water🔽with a fine-meshed net,
whatever living beings there are in the water
would be caught in the net.
Those who have intention,
whether with form or formless;
all of them within your knowledge
are included and gathered together.
The world with its ocean and Mount Meru,
overwhelmed by darkness,
having heard your Dhamma,
they cross over the flood of doubt.
In the world covered by ignorance,
When it was enveloped in darkness,
When your knowledge shone,
The darkness was dispelled.
You are the eyes of all,
The remover of the great darkness;
Having heard your Dhamma,
Many people are extinguished.
Having filled a leaf-cup🔽With honey, molasses, and oil,
I raised it with both hands
And offered it to the Great Seer.🔽The Great Hero,
The Great Sage, accepted it with his own hands;
Having eaten it all, the Omniscient One
Rose up into the sky.
The Teacher, standing in the sky,
The one who sees the meaning, the best of men,
In order to gladden my mind,
Spoke these verses:
‘By this knowledge that has been developed,
And by praising the best of Buddhas,
By this gladdening of mind,

analyzed: duggatim saḥ na gacchati  saḥ  deva rajjam karissati
translated: He will not go to a bad destination.🔽Fourteen times he will rule🔽As king of the gods;
He will rule the earth
For eight hundred years.
For five hundred times
He will be a wheel-turning monarch;
He will rule over countless minor kingdoms,
he will have it made on the ground.
A reciter, a bearer of mantras,
one who has gone beyond the three Vedas,
in the Dispensation of the Fortunate Gotama,
he will go forth.
With knowledge he will investigate🔽the deep and subtle meaning,🔽he will be a disciple of the Teacher,
named Mogharāja.
Endowed with the three knowledges,
one who has done what had to be done, one without pollutants,
the Leader of the Saṅgha Gotama
will place him at the head of those with deep knowledge.’
Having given up human bonds,
having cut the bonds of existence,
having fully understood all the pollutants,
I live without pollutants.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what had to be done in the Dispensation of the Buddha.”🔽Thus the elder Mogharāja recited these verses.
